wikipedia_page.main: Catherine Cooper Hopley (5 October 1817 – 1911), also known by the pen-name Sarah L. Jones, was a British author, governess, artist, and naturalist known for her books on the American Civil War and her nature books for general audiences, including the first popular book on snakes in the English language.

response: *1817 – Catherine Cooper Hopley, British author and naturalist (d. 1911)
